alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Johnston; Sampson; Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 8:32PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Cumberland, Harnett, Johnston, Sampson and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 832 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldsboro, Smithfield, Mount Olive, Dunn, Benson, Godwin, Selma, Erwin, Coats, Four Oaks, Pine Level, Princeton, Newton Grove, Wade, Falcon, Linden, Hobbton, Spivey`s Corner, Grantham and Mar-Mac. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
